column4: I just found out that I can't upgrade my server to "Intrepid" (Yes I know i'm way behind) because my /boot is too small. Disk layout is like this /dev/md0 -> /boot. About 100M. /dev/md1 -> lvm -> / -> About 250GB. Is it possible to shrink lvm and transfer to /boot? I'm assuming this isn't possible to do "on line" but from a rescue disc?

couple of problems, intrepid is EOL, you'll need to use the old versions server in your apt/sources.list, the other thing you can do is remove old kernels from /boot, ... all this can be done "online" but will require a reboot when done
Yeah, well, I was going for latest LTS but it seems I have to go to Intrepid first?
what version are you running now?
Hardy I think.
you should be able to go directly to The latest LTS from there, I don't see why not
I did this do-upgrade-thing and it seems to go for Intrepid first...
see this page http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/upgrading
do-release-upgrade
Yep, that's the one.
I'll look at that page now. Still, after deleting all but the running kernel in /boot I'm lacking space in there. :-/
you'll need to boot with a live disk to resize your /boot partition, cannot be done on a mounted filesystem
What I suspected. So it is possible to transfer space from an LVM to a Raid1?
Setup of this system was done when it wasn't possible to boot from an LVM. Perhaps it's possible now?
I believe so, hardware raid controller?
Unfortunatly I must have done something stupid while choosing size of /boot since it's way to small...
No. All done in software raid.
how many drives in your array?
It's just two drives on this machine. Plain mirroring.
Except for / where I use LVM on top of it.
Suppose I should download a CD to boot from then. Thanks for your help. Let's see if I can break this system properly... =)

hmmm, You'll need to disconnect one drive, allow the live disk to repartition it, then re-mirror it back to the backup drive after you test the new config, that way you will have a backup in case things go horribly wrong
It should be fine just failing one of the drives I think.
yep, because software raid will be turned off when you mount with the Live Cd, and it will just see the one drive as LVM and /boot on straight raid, good to go
